did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Correspondence, diary, speeches and writings, memoranda, reports, printed matter, and photographs, relating to Polish foreign relations, especially with France and Great Britain, during the interwar period, and to Allied diplomacy and the Polish government in exile during World War II.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Karol Poznanski papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1995.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Increments may have been received since this finding aid was prepared. Please check Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat to find the full extent of the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Karol Poznanski, diplomat, consul general, teacher, writer and émigré activist was born in partitioned Poland and spent most of his life working abroad in the Polish diplomatic service. Educated as a lawyer, he made a significant contribution to the restoration of Poland's consular network. Being only in his early 30s he became Poland's top expert in international negotiations. He served in the capacity of secretary, legal and plenipotentiary delegate of various Polish delegations, and signed agreements with other countries.

Most of Poznanski's life was spent in Great Britain, where he was appointed Consul General in London in 1934. He remained in this position until 1945, when the British withdrew recognition of the government he represented. Thereafter he kept himself busy in the Polish émigré circles where he provided legal assistance and volunteered in many organizations (some of which he created) such as the former Foreign Service officials, refugees, cultural and professional associations. He also performed the functions of administrator of estates, notary public, translator, and judge.

The various series in this collection reflect the different stages of Poznanski's life, mainly the time he spent in Great Britain. This is true especially of the correspondence series, covering to a small degree the 1930s, as well as late 1960s and early 1970s. The same is true with the subject series. Of particular importance is the conventions and treaties series, which illustrates the significant input Poznanski made in the diplomatic arena. The photographs portray individuals and events of Poland's inter-war diplomatic history.
This collection was acquired by the Hoover Institution in 1995.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

scopecontent.p: Certificate, clippings, curriculum vitae, German diplomatic visa, invitations, property records, and visiting cards documenting the life and career of Karol Poznanski, arranged alphabetically by physical form
Letters arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Articles, broadcasts, essays relating to Poznanski's consular as well as instructor's career in the diplomatic service and as contributor to Radio Free Europe, arranged chronologically by title

Agreements, conventions, and treaties signed by Poland with Poznanski's contribution, arranged alphabetically by physical form and therein by country. Includes material relating to Polish law in general
Clippings, correspondence, decrees, lists, memoranda, reports, speeches, will, arranged alphabetically by subject
Brochures, bulletins, pamphlets, periodicals, arranged alphabetically by title
69 prints depicting individuals and events relating to Poland's diplomacy during the inter-war period
Mimeographed copy

2 prints depicting individuals and gatherings during Karol Poznanski's diplomatic service in Great Britain (christening of Grom in Dover?), 1930s
5 prints depicting various individuals or circumstances during Karol Poznanski's consular service in Paris, 1920s and 1930s
4 prints depicting the interiors of the Consulate General in Paris, including Consuls Tadeusz Borkowski and Karol Poznanski, 1930s
1 print depicting the opening ceremony of Poland's Consulate in Paris, 1927
1 print depicting the staff of the Paris Consulate, 1928
1 print depicting Jozef Beck attending a social event in the Royal Castle in Warsaw, 1938
5 prints depicting Tadeusz Boy-Zelenski attending social events in Paris, 1928
2 prints depicting a reception for Bishop Gawlina, attended by Ambassador Chlapowski and Maria Mickiewicz, Paris, 1928
1 print depicting the opening ceremony of Polska Kasa Oszczednosci in Paris, attended by Edward Raczkiewicz, n.d.
1 print depicting the wife of Ambassador Chlapowski and Consul Poznanski, n.d.
1 print depicting Ignacy Paderewski in Lille, France, 1920s
18 prints depicting the ceremony of exhumation and transfer of Juliusz Slowacki's ashes from Paris to Poland, 1927
3 prints depicting the skull of Juliusz Slowacki after exhumation, 1927
3 prints depicting Polish tennis player Jedrzejewska during a Wimbledon competition, 1935
1 print depicting the consecration of the flag of Polish veterans and reservists in France, n.d.
3 prints depicting consecration of the Jozef Pilsudski Society's flag, 1930
1 print depicting senators and members of the Polish Parliament in national costumes during the presidential inauguration ceremony in the Royal Castle, n.d.
3 prints depicting members of the Polish delegation to Polish-Lithuanian negotiations in Lugano, Switzerland, 1925
1 print depicting the personnel of the Polish Consulate in Moscow(?), 1924
4 prints depicting delegates to the Polish-Soviet peace negotiations, Riga, Latvia, 1920
2 prints depicting Polish parishioners gathered outside of a London church, 1935
1 print depicting Polish consuls attending a conference in Paris, 1932
2 prints depicting a large group of diplomats(?) attending a dinner party in Paris, 1932
1 print depicting girls collecting money for Polish relief on the streets of London, 1940
1 print depicting a gathering of scientists(?) outside of Imperial College, London(?) with Marie Curie(?) in the center, late 1920s or early 1930s
1 print depicting a farewell gathering for Adam Lisiewicz at a train station in Paris, 1928
1 print depicting a welcoming party at a Warsaw train station for Chesterton, 1927 April 28
1 print depicting a garden event attended by Polish diplomats in Paris(?) and by Olga Boznanska(?)
